If that didn't work, then it's probably a corrupt file in the downloading. In this case I'm afraid you need to re-download the torrent.

Try to run the Game in compatibility mode; Windows XP SP 3. If you don't know how to do this, feel free to contact our Live Support through www.games4theworld.org when "Online" and ask them to do it for you through TeamViewer. More information will be provided there.


@thedude28
Try to run the Game in compatibility mode; Windows XP SP 3. If you don't know how to do this, feel free to contact our Live Support through www.games4theworld.org when "Online" and ask them to do it for you through TeamViewer. More information will be provided there.


@Quail_Checkers

You don't need to Mount anything in order to play, just read the "Crack" -part in the Installation Guide. 
You have to copy the files ín the "Crack 1" folder to: C:\Program Files (x86)\Electronic Arts\The Sims 3\Game\Bin   and REPLACE them by the existing ones.
Then, you have to copy the files ín the "Crack 2" folder to: C:\Program Files (x86)\Electronic Arts\The Sims 3 Ambitions\Game\Bin   and REPLACE them by the existing ones. 
The Game should work fine now.

Ok I figured this installation out. You need all expansion packs and the base game from Games4theworld to install this. So you need to download The Sims 3 base game, World Adventures, High End Loft Stuff, and Ambitions all from Games4theworld which all can be found here on thepiratebay and neet to be installed the order i mentioned. Just follow their guide until you get to the point where you open up the launcher to update the game as directed. The essential key to being able to install these expansion packs is to avoid updating "The Sims 3" base game to version 1.14. If you do, then the games will not work. So after you got the expansion pack ACTUALLY installed on your computer, you will eventually be instructed from the installation guide to update the game. Go ahead and go to the update tab from the launcher as directed and download the updates. Note that when you clicked update now it will bring up the download manager and download two updates. The first update is so you update the expansion pack which is ok because it will not update The Sims 3 base game to 1.14. The second update is to update The Sims 3 base game to 1.14 which YOU CANNOT DO. So when the updates are done downloading, a window will pop up and ask you if you want to allow the installation of the updates to continue (giving you the option of yes or no). ONLY CLICK YES FOR THE VERY FIRST POP UP WINDOW. Because the first window that pops up, is for the installation of expansion update. The second is for the sims 3 which will update the sims 3 base game to version 1.14. So one your done installing the first update a second window will pop up and all you have to do is click no and the sims 3 base game will not update to version 1.14. After that update step go ahead and crack it and move on to the next expansion pack and repeat what i just explained. Note that when your about to install the next expansion pack, it will tell you that "The Sims 3" base game needs to be updated. Go ahead and allow it to update because it will update The Sims 3 but not to version 1.14. So all in all your final versions of all the games should come out to this.

The Sims 3: 1.12.70.006001
World Adventures: 2.9.10.007002
High End Loft Stuff: 3.5.8.007001
Ambitions: 4.0.87.006001

Have any questions about my instructions just comment here and I'll check in and see if i can help.

I installed all of the expansion all from games4theworld and when i press play i starts loading then stops shows me a window saying "you have installed unofficial copy of Sims please quit or update", but the problem is that i can't update ambitions and all the others are up to date so maybe there's a method to manually update because no matter how many times i refresh the launcher it says all of them are up to date but it says that ambitions is version 0.00.. plz help
and my main game also version 0.0.0 plz help

Ok, recently i updated both The sims 3 and ambitions to version 1.14 and 4.2. What i'm thinking when it shows that a version of the game is 0.0 is that it does not have the proper crack or tslhost. So you can download the updates manually by searching for them, you should be able to find em, and then once you get the updates installed to the latest version, get the cracks from these sites.
The Sims 3 1.14- http://tehparadox.com/forum/f43/sims-3-ver-1-14-11-no-dvd-crack-1155181/

Ambitions 4.2-  http://tehparadox.com/forum/f43/sims-3-ambitions-ver-4-2-32-no-dvd-crack-1155210/

You have to join the site to get the links to download the crack so go ahead and do that then download the cracks and crack it from the program files.

If you have trouble installing the update by it telling you invalid file error, that means the two files that you replaced by the crack are gone. So what you need to do is get the original files and replace the cracks then run the update.

For the sims 3 it should be "TS3.exe" and "TSLHost.dll"

Ambitions should be "TS3EP02.exe" and "TSLHost.dll" (The TSLHost.dll files from both games are NOT THE SAME so don't use the same one for both games)

Hope I hepled!

@ braemon

Ok i see your problem. Like i posted above, when your game says "invalid file error" it means that you cracked the game and tried to install the update. What you need to do is get the original files (the ones you replaced by the crack) and replace the crack and then install the update. BF_SUB.caffeinated_c wrote:I had it crash to desktop straight after loading (about 20 seconds of actual ingame before the crash) and having had a similar problem on Fallout 3 that a modder on a forum had fixed, I decided to give it a go with this. It worked for me, maybe it will for you:

Download and install (I am not a bot or an evil virus-spreader, honest folks!):
http://www.ntcore.com/files/ExplorerSuite.exe

Go to "C:\Program files\Electronic Arts\The Sims 3 Ambitions\Game\Bin"

And find a program called "TS3EP02"

**Copy this file somewhere where you can find it again, we need to make a backup (for when EA releases an official patch)**

Right click the original file > "open with CFF explorer"

You now have a window open "CFF explorer - [TS3EEP02]

On the left, under "NT Headers", there should be a tab called "File Header" Click it.

Then click on the area, towards the right of the window, labelled "Click Here"

A "Chacteristics" box will open. Check the option "App can handle >2gb Address space"

Click ok

**MAKE SURE YOU HAVE DONE THE BACKUP AS I SAID EARLIER**

Close CFF explorer

save changes to original file.

Hopefully it will work for you too.

When EA releases a patch that fixes this, or if this didn't work for you, simply find the original copy you made (because you did do that didn't you?) and overwrite the modified file with the original copy. This will allow the patch to install (because it won't on a modified .exe) and will revert the changes we made above
